description.p: The Chakram is a non-popular throwing weapon. Mostly a razor-sharp circle which may return to the owner.
The chakram returns to you when thrown, unless you failed an attack by rolling a natural 1.

description.p: A small shimmering stone. With this stone the Arcanum of Zuiburg is able to deliver messages to it's bearer and vice versa.
A mysterious pink brew that has some strange effects. It's one of the most alcoholic beers.
The beer burns with rose-colored flames and creates dreamy hallucinations around it's drinker including pinkish bubbles while exhaling.
Drinking this brew and using something like a dragons breath may create a rose-colored scenery telling fairy tales or legends.
A small mysterious bread in shape of a cloudy sheep. It reminds of a blueish-rose colored cotton candy.

Eating one of those loave let's you sleep for 6 hours without interruptions. During those 6 hours you will have wonderful dreams and awake fully recovered. Determine with your DM what is included in that recovery.
This item is considered as a harmless drug and can make you addicted. Those who don't need to sleep (but can choose too) are immune to the addiction.
A tiny mysterious berry in a peachy-rose color and a very smooth surface. It reminds of a some candy or bubblegum. They are first found in Hailukia.
Eating one of those let's you heal for one d6. It also cleanses poisonous substances from your body.
The side effects: you feel kind of befuddling after eating them. Not to say 'high'.
If you are poisoned by something, your DM determines how many of those berries you have to eat to cleanse it. Same goes for the intensity and duration of the befuddling effect.
This necklace is infused with the power of Selune.
Wearing this necklace, you no longer need sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. You can gain the benefits of a long rest by doing light activities during the time needed.
Additionally once per long rest you may regain 1d4 hit points for every 2 levels of your character (rounded down). For example 1d4 at lv2 and 4d4 at lv8.

This greatsword is forged with hellish fire and belonged to a devil from the 9th Hell of Baator. It seems like he wants it back...
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the following additional properties.

Fdipy isicy. You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word Fdipy isicy, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra 3d4 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.
Cursed. This sword is cursed. The DM determines the curse and how it can be lifted.
The core of this sword was extracted from the Elemental Plane of Fire, but in it's current form
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the following additional properties.

Flinnhe ivikhe. You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word Flinnhe ivikhe, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra 1d8 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.
